p: After completion of reversed austenite transformation on heating, austenite started to grow, as shown in Figure 2. The austenite grain size at different temperatures was measured on the CLSM samples using the circular-intercept method. The austenite growth rate was plotted in Figure 3. It reveals that the grain size growth rate was small below the temperature of 1100 °C on continuous heating. There was a sharp increase in austenite growth from 1100 °C up to 1250 °C. When the peak temperature of 1308 °C was attained, the maximum grain size of ~52 μm was observed and almost no growth was found during the following continuous cooling until it reached austenite decomposition temperature.
